channel.title: 317 commands
channel.description: I am trying to learn about making private servers and I am currently using aggroth for my source, 1 thing I am having trouble with is adding commands. I have put the code for basic commands into the command folder, but none of these work. Probably something really easy but can't figure it out :/. Thanks for the help!

item.title: 317 commands
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“Paradox68, post:5, topic:547018”][quote author=runescape sucks link=topic=665916.msg4454060#msg4454060 date=1413576067]

[quote author=Paradox68 link=topic=665916.msg4454051#msg4454051 date=1413571029]I say download a delta or hyperion base until you’re good at coding, then move onto the higher revisions.
[/quote]

I mean, these are kind of different in terms of user-friendliness. Delta is probably not something you should recommend because of it’s non-packaging. If anything, recommend a PI.
[/quote]

Pretty sure there’s enough Project Insanity servers out there.[/quote]
It’s for learning purposes, however both of you are wrong for suggesting any of those bases. All full of bad habits and redundancies, the OP should begin by learning a programming language before attempting to manipulate an API.

@OP, as for your specific problem, it sounds like you have not compiled the changed files. (Or even have JDK installed at that).

Read full topic

item.title: 317 commands
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

Paradox68:

I say download a delta or hyperion base until you’re good at coding, then move onto the higher revisions.

I mean, these are kind of different in terms of user-friendliness. Delta is probably not something you should recommend because of it’s non-packaging. If anything, recommend a PI.

item.title: 317 commands
item.dc:creator: @Paradox68 Paradox68
item.description:
@Paradox68 wrote:

I’d suggest starting coding with an easier base. So many people come on these forums with the most basic of issues such as adding commands or changing yell colors because they never bothered to take learning steps. With the more complicated revisions you’ll find yourself lost a lot more often. I say download a delta or hyperion base until you’re good at coding, then move onto the higher revisions.

Read full topic

item.title: 317 commands
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

That’s not right…
That is a .txt file, first off. Meaning it’s probably a backup…
The actual commands file is a .Java file
Located typically in:
src/server/model/players/packets/Commands.java

Read full topic
